text: {| id="drugInfoBox" style="float: right; clear: right; margin: 0 0 0.5em 1em; background: #ffffff;" class="toccolours" border=0 cellpadding=0 align=right width="240px" |- | align="center" colspan="2" | Illustration of an HLA-DR (Human MHC class II) antigen receptor with bound antigen |- | align="center" colspan="2" | major histocompatibility complex, class II, DR18 |- | bgcolor="#e7dcc3" | Haplotypes groups | bgcolor="#eeeeee" | DRA*01:DRB1*0302 DRA*01:DRB5*0303 |- | colspan="2" bgcolor="#dddddd" | Structure (See HLA-DR) |-style="background:#f8f8f8" | bgcolor="#dddddd" | Identifiers|| align="center" | alpha *0101 |- | bgcolor="#e7dcc3" | Symbol(s) | bgcolor="#eeeeee" | HLA-DRA |- | bgcolor="#e7dcc3" | EBI-HLA | bgcolor="#eeeeee" | DRA*0101 |-style="background:#f8f8f8" | bgcolor="#dddddd" | Identifiers|| align="center" | beta 1 *0302 *0303 |- | bgcolor="#e7dcc3" | Symbol(s) | bgcolor="#eeeeee" | HLA-DRB1 |- | bgcolor="#e7dcc3" | EBI-HLA | bgcolor="#eeeeee" | DRB5*0302 |- | bgcolor="#e7dcc3" | EBI-HLA | bgcolor="#eeeeee" | DRB1*0303 |- | colspan="2" bgcolor="#dddddd" | Shared data |- | bgcolor="#e7dcc3" | Locus | bgcolor="#eeeeee" | chr.6 6p21.31 |- |} HLA-DR18 (DR18) is a HLA-DR serotype that recognizes the DRB1*0302 and *0303 gene products. Compared to DR17 which is found at high frequency in Western Europe, DR18 is found more in SE Europe and Central Asia. ==Serology== {| border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" align="left" style="text-align:center; background:#ffffff; margin-right: 1em; border:2px #e0e0ff solid;" |+ DR18 recognition of some DRB1*03 allelesderived from IMGT/HLA |- style="background:#f0f0ff" | style="width:60px" | DRB1* || style="width:60px" | DR18 | style="width:60px" | DR3 || style="width:60px" | DR17 || style="width:60px" | Sample |- style="background:#f0f0ff" | allele || % || % || % || size (N) |- | style = "background:#e8e8f8" | 0302 || 66 || 24 || 3 || 317 |- | style = "background:#e8e8f8" | 0303 || 60 || 40 || || 5 |- |} DR18 recognizes the DRB1*0302 and *0303, the thoroughness of recognition is fair, but better than DR3. ==Disease associations== DR18 seropositivity is associated with rheumatoid polyarthritis DRB1*0302 is positively associated with juvenile diabetes, nuclear helicase Mi-2 autoantibodies in inflammatory inclusion body myositis. ==Genetic Linkage== {| id="drugInfoBox" style="float: right; clear: right; margin: 0 0 0.5em 1em; background: #ffffff;" class="toccolours" border=0 cellpadding=0 align=left width="280px" |-style="background:#f8f8f8" |align="center" colspan="4" | DR18 Haplotypes |-style="background:#f8f8f8" ! bgcolor="#dddddd"| Serotypes ! bgcolor="#dddddd"| DRA !! bgcolor="#dddddd"| DRB1 !! bgcolor="#dddddd" | DRB3 |-style="background:#f8f8f8" | rowspan = "1" bgcolor="#e7dcc3" | DR18(3)-DR52 | bgcolor="#eeeeee"| *0101 || bgcolor="#eeeeee"| *0302 || bgcolor="#eeeeee" | *0101 |-style="background:#f8f8f8" | bgcolor="#dddddd"| ! bgcolor="#dddddd"| DQA1 !! bgcolor="#dddddd"| DQB1 !! bgcolor="#dddddd" | DRB1 |- | rowspan = "1" bgcolor="#e7dcc3" | D18(3)-DQ2(2.5) | bgcolor="#eeeeee"| *0501 || bgcolor="#eeeeee"| *0201 || bgcolor="#eeeeee" | *0302 |-style="background:#f8f8f8" | bgcolor="#dddddd"| ! bgcolor="#dddddd"| HLA-A !! bgcolor="#dddddd"| HLA -B !! bgcolor="#dddddd" | DRB1 |- | rowspan = "1" bgcolor="#e7dcc3" | A33-B58-DR18(3) | bgcolor="#eeeeee"| *3301 || bgcolor="#eeeeee"| *5801 || bgcolor="#eeeeee" | *0302 |- |} HLA-DR18 is genetically linked to DR52 and HLA-DQ2 serotypes. These serotypes are the result of gene products from the HLA-DRB3* and HLA DQA1*0501 and HLA DQB1*0201 alleles. ==References== 3
title: HLA-DR18
